column4: Why does synaptic and apt keep reminding me: Warning: The following packages cannot be authenticated!  whats up with people not sigining these packages?
are they ubuntu (main, restricted, uni- or multiverse) packages ?
Im not sure yet.  Im trying to get a understanding of Ubuntu's repositories
the ubuntu packages *should* all be signed, afaik
possibly. i'm not sure
do you want dpkg -l ?
does that check to see if a package is installed?
not clear what your question is about... what are you trying to do?
im about to compile a kernel, I was curious what linux-headers are
there's a linux-headers package which is needed for compiling kernel modules corresponding to a particular ubuntu kernel image
it include C header files (.h files) and kernel config information
you almost sounded like a microsoft commercial
assimilation is inevitable
remove the quotation marks from that
yessir
thinkcspy is good for beginner programmers
http://www.ibiblio.org/obp/thinkCSpy/    --- imo diveintopython is for those who've done a bit of coding before
also, try #python on this server
maybe do 'pkill gnome-panel' and try again
any more suggestions? that doesnt work?
hmm. other that logout and login, no
does 'pgrep gnome-panel' show anything ?
after killing the panel 5 times it went away. Confused on panel activity, I am.
try maybe 'sudo lshw' or 'sudo lshal', or look in /proc/ide or /proc/scsi
